'Catarrhini' is one of the two subdivisions of the higher primates (the other
being the New World monkeys or platyrrhines). It contains the Old World monkeys
and the apes; the latter of which are in turn further divided into the lesser
apes or gibbons and the great apes, consisting of the orangutans, gorillas,
chimpanzees, bonobos, and humans. They are all native to Africa and Asia.
Members of this parvorder are called 'catarrhines'.
